templates.name: Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2
templates.description:
Template Net Mikrotik

MIBs used:
HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
MIKROTIK-MIB

Known Issues:

  Description: Doesn't have ifHighSpeed filled. fixed in more recent versions
  Version: RouterOS 6.28 or lower

  Description: Doesn't have any temperature sensors
  Version: RouterOS 6.38.5
  Device: Mikrotik 941-2nD, Mikrotik 951G-2HnD

Template tooling version used: 0.38

triggers.name: Mikrotik: Unavailable by ICMP ping
triggers.description: Last three attempts returned timeout.  Please check device connectivity.

triggers.expression: min(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/icmppingloss,5m)<100
triggers.name: Mikrotik: High ICMP ping loss
Mikrotik: High ICMP ping response time

dependencies.name: Mikrotik: High ICMP ping loss
dependencies.expression: min(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/icmppingloss,5m)<100

items.name: Mikrotik: SNMP traps (fallback)
items.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

items.name: Mikrotik: System contact details
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person.  If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

items.name: Mikrotik: System description
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and
networking software.

triggers.expression: (last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.firmware,#1)<>last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.firmware,#2))=1 and length(last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.firmware))>0
triggers.name: Firmware has changed
triggers.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

triggers.expression: (last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.serialnumber,#2))=1 and length(last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
triggers.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
triggers.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

items.name: Mikrotik: Uptime (hardware)
items.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

items.name: Mikrotik: System location
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor').  If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

items.name: Mikrotik: System name
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.  If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

triggers.expression: last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.name,#1)<>last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.name))>0
triggers.name: Mikrotik: System name has changed
triggers.event_name: Mikrotik: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
triggers.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

items.name: Mikrotik: Uptime (network)
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

items.name: Mikrotik: System object ID
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity.  This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed.  For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

triggers.expression: (last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0],#1)<>last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0],#2))=1 and length(last(/Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0]))>0
triggers.name: Operating system description has changed
triggers.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

items.name: Total memory
items.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The size of the storage represented by this entry, in
units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is
writable to allow remote configuration of the size of
the storage area in those cases where such an
operation makes sense and is possible on the
underlying system. For example, the amount of main
memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or
the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory
might be modified.

items.name: Used memory
items.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

triggers.name: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
triggers.description: The system is running out of free memory.

items.name: Mikrotik: SNMP agent availability
items.description:
Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list.
Possible value:
0 - not available
1 - available
2 - unknown

triggers.name: Mikrotik: No SNMP data collection
triggers.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototypes.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

discovery_rules.name: Temperature CPU discovery
discovery_rules.description:
MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature
Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototypes.name: CPU: Temperature
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Processor temperature in Celsius (degrees C).
Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..).

discovery_rules.name: Temperature sensor discovery
discovery_rules.description:
MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlTemperature
Since temperature sensor is not available on all Mikrotik hardware,
this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSRP
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSRP Reference Signal Received Power.

trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSRP is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSRP.MIN.WARN}dbm for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSRQ
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSRQ Reference Signal Received Quality.

trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSRQ is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSRQ.MIN.WARN}db for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSSI
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSSI Received Signal Strength Indicator.

trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem RSSI is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSSI.MIN.WARN}dbm for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem SINR
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalSINR Signal to Interference & Noise Ratio.

trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): LTE modem SINR is low (below {$LTEMODEM.SINR.MIN.WARN}db for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP authenticated clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlApAuthClientCount Number of authentication clients.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): SSID
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlApSsid Service Set Identifier.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP registered clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlApClientCount Client established connection to AP, but didn't finish all authetncation procedures for full connection.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP authenticated clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMAuthClientCount Number of authentication clients.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP registered clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMRegClientCount Client established connection to AP, but didn't finish all authetncation procedures for full connection.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP state
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMState Wireless interface state.

trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): AP interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}) is not running
trigger_prototypes.description: Access point interface can be not running by different reasons - disabled interface, power off, network link down.

item_prototypes.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Total space
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The size of the storage represented by this entry, in
units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is
writable to allow remote configuration of the size of
the storage area in those cases where such an
operation makes sense and is possible on the
underlying system. For example, the amount of main
memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or
the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory
might be modified.

item_prototypes.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Used space
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

macros.description: This macro is used in LTE modem discovery. It can be overridden on the host.
This macro is used in CAPsMAN AP channel discovery. It can be overridden on the host level.
The LTE modem RSRP minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem RSRQ minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem RSSI minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem SINR minimum value for warning trigger expression.
